designations.source: A Review of the scarce and threatened spiders (Araneae) of Great Britain: Species Status No. 22 (Sep 2017)
designations.source_description: This review assesses the threat of extinction, based on IUCN Red List categories, for the species recorded in Britain and considered eligible for consideration under those IUCN criteria. This report was commissioned to update the national threat status of Araneae using IUCN methodology for assessing threat. It covers all species of Arachnids in Great Britain, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non-threatened and non-native species.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Category for a taxon when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual potentially capble of reproduction within the region has died or has disappeared from the wild in the region, or when, if it is a former visiting taxon, the last individual has died or disappeared in the wild from the region. The setting of any time limit for listing under RE is left to the discretion of the regional Red List authority, but should not normally pre-date 1500 AD.
designations.comments: No records of this distinctive spider since 1950 and its habitat was destroyed in 1954. Threats: The vegetation where the spider was found at Burnham Beeches was mown to the ground in 1954 despite the SSSI designation of the site three years earlier.
